intro: Ebnerella icamolensis, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. It produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Ebnerella icamolensis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
